item.title: There are no elected officials left in Haiti
item.description:
Jeffsky Poincy üá≠üáπ on Twitter

‚ÄúAs of today, Haiti does not have a single elected official. The 3 branches of power are dysfunctional. The International community (BINUH and The Core Group) is the main decision-maker. We are perhaps further away from democracy than we were in the early 90s.‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/jeffsky_poincy/status/1612554595154395137

item.title: Chollet with some GPT skepticism
item.description:
Fran√ßois Chollet on Twitter

‚ÄúThe current climate in AI has so many parallels to 2021 web3 it‚Äôs making me uncomfortable. Narratives based on zero data are accepted as self-evident. Everyone is expecting as a sure thing ‚Äúcivilization-altering‚Äù impact (& 100x returns on investment) in the next 2-3 years‚Äù

item.title: Tuvok @ NaughtyDog on Twitter
item.description:
Tuvok @ NaughtyDog on Twitter

‚ÄúMicrosoft have announced their AI ‚ÄúVALL-E‚Äù Using a 3-second sample of human speech, it can generate super-high-quality text-to-text speech from the same voice. Even emotional range and acoustic environment of the sample data can be reproduced. Here are some examples.‚Äù

item.title: Joshua Kim comment on my higher education worries
It seems Mastodon is sinking?
item.description:
Matt Navarra on Twitter

‚ÄúMastodon is struggling to keep users engaged The number of active users on Mastodon has dropped more than 30% and is continuing a slow decline There were about 1.8 million active users in the 1st week of January, down from over 2.5m in early December https://t.co/sRGlIojmfC‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/MattNavarra/status/1612423504825126913

item.title: Nathan Labenz on Gary Marcus and AI
item.description:
Nathan Labenz on Twitter

‚Äúas an AI obsessive and long-time @ezraklein fan, I was excited to see yesterday‚Äôs podcast with @GaryMarcus. Unfortunately, as I listened, my excitement gave way to frustration, and I felt compelled to write my first-ever megathread. Quotes from: https://t.co/ePWGXvaoMc‚Äù

item.title: responding and critical of GPT
item.description:
Gary Marcus on Twitter

‚ÄúThis popular defense of #GPT is fundamentally misguided. Its main claim is that ChatGPT has substantially solved an earlier set of problems, and that‚Äôs just not true. Consider examples like these just *from the last 48 hours*, all reinforcing my fundamental points. [Thread]‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/garymarcus/status/1612155191616483329?s=58&t=KRzv5tm0plRh6ah66Gp1fA

AEA meeting update
item.description:
Martha Olney üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà on Twitter

‚ÄúRegistration at #ASSA2023 was 6,000 in advance vs 12,000 at #assa2020 in San Diego. Missing include 1.5k job market candidates, ~2-3k interviewers, others. Impact: $900K loss on meeting. Effect: reg fees will go up for 2024. Per #aea sec/treas Rousseau at business meeting.‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/MarthaOlney/status/1611519172663734272
